Instruction: Whisk the egg whites in a glass or metal bowl until foamy. Gradually incorporate sugar and lemon juice, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift the beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites will form sharp peaks.
Place dollops of the egg mixture by heaping teaspoonfuls onto a baking sheet, creating small peaked mounds.
Bake until lightly browned and dry on the outside yet soft on the inside, approximately 15 to 20 minutes.
During the Christmas season, a small drop of red or green food coloring can be added to lightly tint these cookies. You can also sprinkle seasonal decorations on top before baking.
